meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something with force.
meanings.sent1: She squushed the playdough in her hands.
meanings.sent2: The elephant squushed the banana with its trunk.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally squushed his sandwich in his backpack.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books squushed the delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler squushed his opponent with a powerful move.

meanings.sent1: The chef squushed the garlic cloves with a knife.
meanings.sent2: The steamroller squushed the cans on the road.
meanings.sent3: The cat squushed the cardboard box to make a cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: The giant foot squushed the tiny village in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rock squushed the fragile twig underneath.

meanings.definition: To make something compact by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: She squushed her clothes into the suitcase for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The trash compactor squushed the empty cans efficiently.
meanings.sent3: He squushed the snow into a snowball and threw it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The machine squushed the metal sheets into thin plates.
meanings.sent5: The child squushed the clay into different shapes with delight.
